website_summaries.verdict: Durable compact router that will be able to handle the really tough jobs that you may encounter.
pros: Can adjust bit depth up to 1/64th of an inch
Offers multiple speed options, providing precise control over the device
Includes strong 1.25 horsepower motor that will last a long time
Includes two LEDs with a clear see-through sub-base, making it easy to see the work area
cons: Won't stand up to usage of many hours per day without needing servicing

customer_reviews.title: Hard working router
customer_reviews.text: I put this router through a tough job. I spent 5 hours machining an AR lower. The router and bits were hot but never stopped working. The bit did come loose halfway through the job, so be sure to check tightness often. Cheap tools are good for something things but if you want the best get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K.

customer_reviews.title: Well built and does what I wanted  - milling aaluminum & polymer.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered specifically for milling AR15 80% lowers using 5d Tactical jig.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great 80% lower tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this router to mill 80% AR15 lowers. It works great. The adjustment is precise and solid. Also, the grip on the end mill is very solid. I have used other routers that have had both issues and it makes it very difficult to do a good job milling out the receiver. Mechanically, this DWP611 is excellent. However, the LED's have stopped working on mine all most completely. Not an issue for me as I don't use them anyway. Otherwise, an excellent tool for milling lowers.
customer_reviews.author: C. PATTERSON

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for milling 7075 Aluminium!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet router. Mills through 7075 aluminium like butter. Features and quality exceed other routers in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: S. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Hoping I just got a bad unit. Amazon was quick to send me a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked with it for several hours yesterday and it worked flawlessly. This morning I went to do some more work and the end mill bit started to dip down into the work piece. Thought the locking mechanism might be loose, but it wasn't. Turned it back on and the router kicked hard to the left, started making a rattling noise, and spit out bits of black plastic. Turns out the motor is held in place by a black plastic collar and that piece failed. Hoping I just got a bad unit. Amazon was quick to send me a replacement. When it gets here I'll see if the new unit functions any better and update this review as necessary.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Two of these have died.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these, and after a couple of months of light, occasional use, the motor sparked and died. I had a lot of investment in accessories, so I bought another just like it. It died today. Motor just stopped working. That’s two that died. I hardly use the thing, so it’s not “worn out”
customer_reviews.author: FatherOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: Compact Router
customer_reviews.text: This small router is a work horse, I really enjoy using it. If you are on the fence about buying one, go ahead and pull the trigger, You will not be disappointed. I wish Dewalt would go back to the hard shell cases. The instructions that come with their tools is no longer a book style but a open page type. Dewalt if you are listening. go back to offering hard shell cases, we will pay for the option and get back to a book style instruction instead of a page you get with the tool now Other then these complaints you have a great tool
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This compact router surprised me! I wasn’t sure if it would be powerful enough for my project or if it would be too loud to use when the kids were asleep. This had the power to mill aluminum, and it was quiet enough to use it at night when the family was sleeping. I do wish the led lights were a little brighter, but hey, they were a nice feature! Adjusting the depth was easy, very easy, just be sure to tighten the adjusting screw before you start routing. All in all, a good value for the money, and I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Hand Luke

customer_reviews.title: Ease of depth adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine. Very easy to Mike small precision adjustments to depth. Securely locks in place
customer_reviews.author: Steven parry Wilson

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these over a year ago to use as a CNC router and it works great. It started making unusual noises, and I had quite a few orders making signs for Christmas. Worried about it breaking down, I purchased a 2nd one that is still new in the box, as the first one just needed the sawdust blown out of it. Runs like new again. I'm still keeping the 2nd one as a back up, or I will use by hand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Solid and smoothly operating tool.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with an AR lower machining jig. This is a nice quality tool, heavier and more solid than it looks...height adjust locking felt like it wouldn't be reliable at first but has since proven to be solid in use. I took off one star for this 'feel' issue. Startup is excellent and smooth. For my use I have to start the tool with a bit down in a previously bored hole in aluminum, so a kickback could be catastrophic. Not an issue - with a reasonably solid grip the tool doesn't move on startup. Really happy with this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Bob J

customer_reviews.title: It is heavier than I expected, though I knew it weighed 4#...I'm 85 years old !
customer_reviews.text: Have not used as this writing; all the features are as listed. Having used routers for sometime I'm confident it will meet my requirements. My other two routers are too big for my intended use i.e., fixed mounted cutting wood threads in dowel material turned on my wood lathe. Having read reviews on six or more like routers, I agree this is one of the best. Nothing is perfect when made for a wide variety of users; the "soft start" feature is not as good as my Bosch plunge which does not move untouched on my bench, this little guy moves.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Steffens

customer_reviews.title: It did a fantastic job. Just remember
customer_reviews.text: Used to mill out my 80% AR-15 lower. It did a fantastic job. Just remember: it's not a race to finish. Take your time for each pass.
customer_reviews.author: Weegee

customer_reviews.title: It's a great piece of equipment to have.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model before and I love it. However when my last one shorted out (due to a bad Geni because my friends uncle is a cheap SOB plus the fact that the Geni was dated 1971) so once the fuses didn't kick in it shorted out this as well as my Bluetooth speaker and his nephew's cell and tablet. This happened because he was charging them at the time because he was trying to order lunch for all of us. Needless to say that we were all not too happy about this. But as for this router, you can't beat the quality.
customer_reviews.author: THUNDER

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a CNC Spindle
customer_reviews.text: I bought for use with an X-Carve CNC. The unit works great with no modification. The only issue is that the RPM is a bit high for milling. However, for wood or metal, it'll work. With plastic, I find at least one finishing pass is necessary because of the RPM. The only reason I'm rating 4 stars, is the power switch. Twice I have turned the router off but it popped back into the ON position. I've learned to properly depress the switch now, but seems like that shouldn't have happened--twice.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Compact, yet extremely powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have onlt used this router twice so far. My main reason for purchasing it was to use it in conjunction with an end mill bit and jig set. This allowed me to accurately and quickly mill aluminum. For a tool that is physically so small, it has a surprising amount of power. I've been extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W. Fettweis

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I waited this long to get a router
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how I have survived so long without one. I have been woodworking since high school and have a fair number of power tools, but for some reason I never thought I needed a router. Every time a project came up where I thought I might need one, I was able to figure out another way to do things. I wasted so much time! I mainly do just DIY stuff around the house, but I can already see how many more projects I can do with this, and how I could have done a much better job on past projects.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Beaugrand

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to routing & tools for that matter. Bought awhile back just because it was a deal of the day. Honestly never saw or knew what routers did. Got bored one day & you tubed them real quick. Figured I'd start wood / MDF carving. Bought cheap Harbor Freight bits & took the plunge. I mainly use it for making art for myself. Love it. Works great. Never had any issues with the motor bogging or the bits coming loose. Never an issue with cutting levels moving. Works great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: The clamp on the adjustment is worthless. The Allen screw loosens on its on after using a bit which causes damage to your piece. Try tightening and would be too tight and where clamp won’t open. Loosen it and your setting would be lost. Wasted money. I’m going back to my Ryoby. At least it’s bit stayed where you put it.
customer_reviews.author: David Lundy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a minute.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small package with plenty of power and really nice depth adjustment. It’s too bad it just stopped working mid project. LEDs still come on but the motor will not turn on at any speed. Maybe just a one in a million but very inconvenient right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff E.

customer_reviews.title: Junk don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router 7 months ago and hardly used it. It stopped working today. The motor will not turn on. I think I paid for a new one and was given refurbished. It is loud for a small router. Buy a different brand!.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router
customer_reviews.text: After reading many compact router reviews, I settled on this one. My immediate need was to do some roundovers in pine and some flush cutting of melamine. This router did wonderfully, it was able to push through the material easily and provided nice smooth cuts. I found this to be very quiet for a router and there isn't much of a kick when initially starting it up. Chip ejection was great and I never had problems with material blocking my view of the cutting area. Changing bits was easy as was depth adjustment. This is going to get way more use than my full sized router.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I owned it for three month and the motor died. The lights still function however the motor itself quit working. It had approximately 15 or so hours of run time total for those 3 months. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Seth L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use, accurate easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it a lot, but for first impression i can say: very comfortable to maneuver and easy to control i did some very accurate notches at different widths. It sits good i my hands and I'm not big guy. I am not experiences with routers but i have big bosch that wasn't comfortable to use and i didn't like working with it. I should have started with smaller one like the DeWalt, or other models of bosch, but after reading the reviews decided on the DeWalt!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sany haim

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for a router
customer_reviews.text: Overall the router works very well. The only issue encountered was with bits loosening in the collet, even though the collet and bit shank were clean and the collet properly torqued. This only happened under more severe conditions. A better quality collet may preclude this situation,. The router itself works very well. The depth control is not as precise as one might prefer but good enough for the class of tool. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BeK

customer_reviews.title: It’s garbage
customer_reviews.text: Made in Mexico garbage. I’ve never had a router jump so much; garbage. I’m off this garbage brand.
customer_reviews.author: LURO

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these on my CNC for woodcarving so it only made sense to buy another one for my lower receiver making. These routers put up with a lot and provide me endless hours of work. I have had to replace brushes on my CNC but that was after many months of daily use at max RPM. I keep extra brushes on hand because of the abuse I put them through but haven’t had to use anymore.
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, well built and quiet and not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router, a little more pricey than competitors, but it's well built, quiet and has decent power. I've first got in with the intention of using it for light jobs and trimming, but since I live in a small NYC apartment with no space for a real power tool collection, I end up using this router for cutting through thick wood(2x4's) for small projects using a 1/8th spiral cut bit. The 2 LED lights at the bottom also does a pretty good job of illuminating the work surface, and it's not too loud, even at the medium setting.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts aluminum no problem! Used to finish an Ar lower and it did great, no chatter and never bogged down. I highly recommend this router!!
customer_reviews.author: Jfer87

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and powerful to get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I wanted it for. To make signs. Fits nicely in your hand, and easy to get fine detailed carving. The light makes it easy to see what you're carving. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a compact trim router. Powerful enough to get the job done, without the weight that can sometimes be hard to manage. Buy it. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Fredo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Beat
customer_reviews.text: After using other routers for milling, this little DeWalt is a dream-come-true. The lighted, small clear base gives you an unparalleled amount of viewing your progress as you work. I use mine in conjunction with a 5-D Tactical Milling Jig working with 7075 and 6061-T6 aluminum alloys. The former can be a little tough to work with, and other router motors will heat up long before the DeWalt gets warm. And its other features make precision adjustments really easy. I wish I'd found out about this little router a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted one of these for a while but didn't have a good reason until I needed to mortise out a bunch of door hinges. It worked great for that purpose, and will be helpful in future projects where I don't need to use my larger router. The instructions were fine, albeit a little confusing, but I was able to get up and running pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the DWP611 for use on a Shapeoko 3. I'm a long time fan of Dewalt tools - having many of their cordless drills, saws, routers, and such. Generally good quality for an affordable price. In my experience, all their products stand up well to use (albeit I'm just an amateur at woodworking and CNC). The DWP611 is no exception. There are numerous competitors in this class of small, handheld routers. I liked the DWP611 because of the variable speed feature and the built in light. As I said, I use this on a CNC machine, good speed control and repeatable rpm settings are important. Good price, typical Dewalt quality. You won't go wrong owning this, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S

customer_reviews.title: Great arm saver
customer_reviews.text: This has LOTS of power. It’s DeWalt so I can’t say that surprises me. Works great at what it does. Saves a lot of fatigue over busting out the big router for everything. Only thing I see that needs improvement is the up down adjustment mechanism appears to be a little flimsy for DeWalt, but time will tell if it stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Domino2178

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hand held router! Expect no less from DeWalt products!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to supplement a bosch 'pony' handheld to cut down on bit changes in the shop. The DeWalt definitely has more power and the led's are nice but for one hand operation I prefer the pony. The only downside to the DeWalt itself though is the lack of availability of a hard case. Have used DeWalt tools for years- they are rugged and durable tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value. Shapeoko xxl
customer_reviews.text: Great little bundle of power. Used on the shapeoko and it’s been cranking out designs for the past few months without any issues. Great durability and the range in speed works fairly well with the cnc. Would like a bit slower but can’t complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Lime

customer_reviews.title: Much superior to Bosch it is replacing
customer_reviews.text: Robust, nice sizable clear base, strong and positive height elevation, nice ergonomics, good rotor lock. This is truly a compact router and not just a laminate trimmer, capable of much of the work I have been doing with heavy and awkward full size routers.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Meredith

customer_reviews.title: It has easy height adjustment and is comfortable to handle even with ...
customer_reviews.text: I have three different routers but this is my go to router for sure. It has easy height adjustment and is comfortable to handle even with one hand. The variable speed and soft start features work as expected. Bits are easy to change and the LED lighting is a plus. I am merely a weekend woodworker and not a professional but this item does receive my recommendation. Good quality and function.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: Loved the features but did not last - Dewalt replaced at no cost!  Really stood behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: Burned bearings after 12 hrs use. Loved the features but did not last. Update: DeWalt will send a replacement unit at no cost to me! Fantastic customer support! Exceeded expectations. Going forward I will only buy DeWalt. I have an 18V Makita cordless drill that stripped the planetary gearset the first time I tried to drill a hole for a door knob. They would not repair it even though it was only 3 months old. It will be replaced with DeWalt!
customer_reviews.author: Mauricemk

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Did I mention I loved it? Great tool I literally can't wait to use again. I'm looking for projects. The 20v is coming out in February, but I'll have to check out some reviews on that one first. This one was rated highly, and for good reason. It's a game changer from the huge beast routers (which are great when you need the half inch collect). Anyway, if you can't wait to see how the cordless is going to do, this is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: OneStepFurther

customer_reviews.title: Another solid tool from DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. A little on the heavy side but not unreasonably, nice to have the variable speed. The lower portion can be removed from the motor body for changing the bit. The latch can be adjusted so that it grips the motor body more or less tightly. The tool's "top" end is flat so that it will sit upside down. The depth adjustment screw is not super-precise, but with some care and attention can be adjusted to within thousandths of an inch.
customer_reviews.author: enrique

customer_reviews.title: Really like this router
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this router for the first time this evening, and i was very impressed with the ease of changing the bits, and adjusting of height. Router had a lot of power, and i really like the speed control as well... I would definitely recommend this router to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Great Performing Router
customer_reviews.text: I have several routers from different manufactures. This one is very sturdy and has been a great performer. Ergonomically, it's easy to hold and control, it isn't too heavy and is easy to grip. It locks down securely and the adjustments are easy to make. I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: rocklock hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Using this in my OpenBuilds CnC as a spindle. Works great in that role. I put a dust shoe on the unit so the built in lights aren't very visible anymore. I could see using one of these in my dedicated circle cutter. Pretty small and reasonably powerful. Never lacked power on this unit yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Compact, powerful, easy to use. The adjustments are easy and stay put in use. It takes a little getting used to controlling the cut as it bites into the wood but very manageable if done slowly. My only regret was not buying the plunge tool addition. That's my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LEN

customer_reviews.title: Nice complement to full-sized router
customer_reviews.text: Very well made with lots of convenient features. The depth adjustment takes a little thought, as it is not intuitive, and instructions are not clear. Once you get it, though, it is not hard to get accurate results. The visibility is pretty good, and the LED lights are a plus. This is a very nice alternative to hauling out my full sized router, especially for edging tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Strong motor, well built.
customer_reviews.text: I use it exclusively with an end mill for milling aluminum. Obviously not designed for such hard work but the router is so strong it cuts through it like soft wood! VERY powerful motor. Relatively light weight, and easy to handle. Adjustments are quick & easy. Shipping was instant.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Gen 2 perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I got this router to use with the 80% Arms gen 2 jig and it works perfectly. I also ended up buying a set of wood tips and even helped my wife with an art project by making a good edge on a wooden cloud and it again was comfortable and easy to use on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great product.... great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product.... great price. Found another router on Amazon and Amazon allowed me to return this and purchase another brand. Other brand had a feature that I needed... and worked out better. I'm sure this router is just as good as the router I purchased... price on both of them was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted for approximately 4 minutes of cumulative time in roughly 30 second increments. I probably won't buy another Dewalt product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lightweight router to do some simple jobs. Found it light and easy to move around your work area. Like all good tools you have to wear ear plugs and safety glasses and this little guy gets loud. It did the job well. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to finish an 80% lower. Was not let down. This is a solid piece of equipment that absolutely lays waste to the job at hand.
customer_reviews.author: DiddyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt name means nothing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the name and guess what The DeWalt name means nothing. I’ve been better off getting a less expensive router because this router only lasted about four months with very little use. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great compact router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact router. I have used it on several projects and it works great. The led lights are a great feature. The size is a nice compromise between a laminate trimmer and a full size router. It can be maneuvered reasonably easily one handed. The square base on one side is also a great feature; it gives the unit more stability, and allows you to hold the square base for extra control, where needed. Also handy when using it with an edge guide. A round clear base is available as an optional accessory. Reasonably powerful for most hobby-type routing jobs. This has much better vertical adjustment than you can achieve with a laminate trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: GrogMeister

customer_reviews.title: Good trim router
customer_reviews.text: Like most DeWalt products, this is an excellent trim router. I got it to replace a very old Ryobi Laminate Trimmer that wore out. The DeWalt has more power, speed and provides a lot more capability, so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: ... c-beam cnc machine and for the moment is working great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this router with my c-beam cnc machine and for the moment is working great!
customer_reviews.author: Josue Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: OVERHEAT?
customer_reviews.text: I have it one day and ran it for 2 straight hours on and off milling aluminum. It was getting very warm to the touch and then it shut down. I thought it overheated but the reports say it has a built in cooler and it won't overheat. I tried running it two hours later when it was cool and it starts up and then shuts down and just hums. This is brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt has seen better days.
customer_reviews.text: The one I got has a lot of vibration. Much more than the Bosch I wanted to replace. I removed the collet and nut to see if that would make a difference bit it did not. I also noticed the ferrite bead on the cord was an empty shell. That speaks to quality control that they would put an empty shell just to make it look official.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: Best of the compact routers available
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for a CNC Router. I needed a router with a spindle that runs true. It has adjustable speed 16,000 to 27,000 rpm. The base is clear plastic, so it is better to see your work.
customer_reviews.author: ff5605

customer_reviews.title: use a real wrench the cheap one that comes with it wont last long
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect and worked great! Only thing that was bad was the cheap little wrench they sent to tighten the chuck. I never expect them to last long and a regular wrench works better anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Using for my CNC machine
customer_reviews.text: I almost felt bad mounting it to my CNC machine and not just keeping it for my palm router. It is built great and feels perfect holding onto it to clean edges. If it does as good of a job as I believe it will, I will be purchasing another for a palm router.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: 5D machine go brrrrrrr
customer_reviews.text: i know what youre doing here& this is exactly what you need. Dont forget the WD-40.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Polce

customer_reviews.title: love it. have several large routers but needed to ...
customer_reviews.text: love it. have several large routers but needed to do some very fine work and looked up reviews in various wood working journals. THis one rated very hign. No real critique that I can think of. The LEDs are VERY NICE to have... getting into mid 60s and eyes need some more light and this one gives it. would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Almost Medicare!

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I am on the fence to give ...
customer_reviews.text: What a beast. I love it. I am on the fence to give it 4 starts because the base it comes with isn't really made for heavy routing (its for small intricate stuff)... but I decided 5 starts because I got the full-size adapter too and this router tears through all.
customer_reviews.author: MirthCastle

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt is king!!
customer_reviews.text: Another dewalt product that doesn't disappoint, plenty of power for milling out ar lower receivers. Light and ergonomics are good. Fairly quiet!
customer_reviews.author: mtcowboy2000

customer_reviews.title: good router to buy, but has a steep learning curve...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this router. I just need to gain more experience with how to use it. Also, a plunger base would really help, but they are SOOO expensive! :-/
customer_reviews.author: carefulresearcher

customer_reviews.title: CROSS THREADED ..
customer_reviews.text: One of the Base Plate screws was cross threaded, made repairs to the screw hole with a thread tap follower. Would have been a problem if I hadn't had the tools on hand.. Hopefully I won't be running into more problems with this router.
customer_reviews.author: TLR

customer_reviews.title: Hope to get this fixed
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this router to use for the first time and it seems to have a bent arbor or main motor shaft as the bits, all of them turn out of round.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for making holes
customer_reviews.text: Great little router. Cheaper than the same model at lowes, with a discount. So far I've only made pistol grips for a 357, but I can see it coming in very handy for lots of stuff. I've always wanted a router and this one seemed like a good buy for a part-time woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: theosus

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I put this router to the test immediately after receiving it. Make sure you get high quality bits. Low quality bits means you'll wear out the motor quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Deforest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This little router is absolutely fantastic. I am new to trim routers after being formerly confident that there were unnecessary and couldn't serve any real benefit over a standard router - WRONG! This is so easy to manuever and does an amazing job. The tool feels incredibly well built and comes with a square-edged plate. It is amazing how powerful the motor is given its size and weight. I will never be without a trim router again and I may be adapting my plunge router to a router table as I doubt I will be using it for much hand work any longer.
customer_reviews.author: natron31

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Love this little router....super handy, powerful and variable speed. Best thing is the length of the adjustment. I use it for milling projects and it's small size, variable speed, and adjustment range make this one easier to use than a full sized one
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT Router, Fixed Base, Variable Speed, 1-1/4-HP Max Torque (DWP611)
customer_reviews.text: delivered just at right time no damage my item is in very good condition,it is good for my installation into workbench Good job Dewalt:)
customer_reviews.author: M.B

customer_reviews.title: Beat the others HANDS DOWN!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expect from DEWALT tools. Solid, great height adjustment, plenty of adjustable power. Far less bulky than my full size routers, and easy to control. I tried 2 others because the DEWALT was always out of stock and returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Tosh

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful hand sized router, easy to run.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little router. I ordered it specifically to build 5 80% AR-15 lowers with a milling bit on aluminum, but it will find uses after that.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for a DIY'er. Probably not intended for a wood-worker. For that, you would want the larger routers. Love when you buy a tool and it performs better than you expected. This one of them. Especially after borrowing a neighbor's cheaper router, and then using this one. HUGE difference in quality and features for almost the same price. The depth adjustment mechanism is excellent and well designed. The soft-start and variable speed features make this an excellent tool for a DIY'er or homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: KLash

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt, as usual great product. It is just small enough for smaller projects and big and powerful enough for the bigger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Bertrand

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this router. Easy to hold on to when operating. The variable speeds are nice. I have used it on aluminum and polymer and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Best one on the market
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt quality, top of the line router. I've learned through the years that when it comes to tools, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Good for SDI PCC capstone course
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for the PCC capstone course at SDI gunsmithing school. It ended up working out very well. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: Great router. I use mine on my CNC machine
customer_reviews.text: Great router. I use mine on my CNC machine. If you do the same, I would highly recommend buying a couple of sets of DEWALT BRAND motor brushes. I have tried the off brand which are cheaper and you get exactly what you pay for. This router is super nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod

customer_reviews.title: great little router
customer_reviews.text: I like this router very much. I do not have a lot of experience with routers but everything about this one has been good. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Good small router
customer_reviews.text: Used this to mill out AR type rifles. Worked well for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Texasrep

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for some small aluminum machining
customer_reviews.text: I had some issues with the lock not clamping tight enough after disassembling and cleaning it looks like it is holding
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great router, at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say.. dewalt makes quality products. This is no exception, plenty of power in a compact size. Very happy with this router!
customer_reviews.author: FAH924

customer_reviews.title: great router
customer_reviews.text: love this thing. i used to use the dremel route kit, didn't know what i was missing till i got this
customer_reviews.author: Grobballer

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt  router works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with router has plenty of power for what I need it for great small size rout
customer_reviews.author: bryan scanlon

customer_reviews.title: Handy size, versatile and great adjustment, but dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I love this little router because it is small in size, versatile and is both easy and accurate to adjust depth. But I also hate it because wrapping your hand around the router to hold it can allow your finger to contact the blade. I did just that and my finger required three stitches but I could have easily lost the entire end of my finger.
customer_reviews.author: T. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Defective collet lock
customer_reviews.text: I have many Dewalt power tools that are great and never let me down until I bought this router. Used it for the first time today and the collet lock pin went flying out the bottom. Now there is no way to tighten the collet. I’ll be returning this and I’ll be going with a different brand
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting is easy
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t get to actually mill my 308 yet but the tool seems solid and easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: James Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Love this dewalt router. Works amazing and cuts everything like butter. Id buy another one, but im sure this one will last me.
customer_reviews.author: Cyang028

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Makita trim router and hat to return it due to collet issues. Paid a little extra for this one and I'm glad I did. It fits my hand better and made smoother cuts with the same bit on the same wood. The light has already come in handy as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great little compact router
customer_reviews.text: Great little compact router! Very well made and it has plenty of power for such a small compact router! Small enough to hold firmly in my hand and yet powerful enough to use in hard woods with a medium size bit. Very handy for the small hand held projects such as making signs and edging tables and other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Wegener

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Router
customer_reviews.text: Great adjustments, easy controls, lightweight, and plenty of power...all for a low price. Can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: A little tank of a router!
customer_reviews.text: One of the BEST palm routers on the market. So easy to change bits and hogs out wood very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Brumac

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The LEDs light up your work area perfectly, and the spinning of the bit seems to blow out all the dust, making it easy to see your work piece. This tool feels so well designed, it’s just raw power in your hands. It’s such a pleasure working with this router
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact router.
customer_reviews.text: I freakin love this thing. Light weight yet powerful. Easy to use. Does it’s job well. I’m a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Spring for this one, don't look at the cheaper models.
customer_reviews.text: Great handheld router. I am brand new to routing so I had to watch a YouTube video or two to get the hang of it, but aside from the instructions assuming you know what you are doing, no complaints at all. Currently using it to build shelving for a vanity.
customer_reviews.author: foxandoctopus

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Very good product. Can’t go wrong with this router. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crossbow88

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little router. Very easy to use for simple jobs. I am a "hack" carpenter" who is still learning. This little router is perfect for simple routing work like rounding edges. I used it on a bench, a chair and a bar I was working on to round out the edges and make them smooth. Small enough that it is easy to handle, but powerful enough to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Brock

product_meta.title: DEWALT Router, Fixed Base, Variable Speed, 1-1/4-HP Max Torque (DWP611)
product_meta.description:
Style:RouterVariable speed control with soft starting motor features full time electronic feedback that maintains motor speed through the cut. Dual LED's and clear sub base ensure maximum visibility, adjustment ring enables controlled bit depth changes, large, low-pressure spindle lock button, multiple shaft lock detents, depth ring, clamping mechanism and spring loaded release tabs. Specs: 7.0 amps, 16,000-27,000 RPM no load speed, 1/4" collet diameter, 1.5" plunge stroke, 4" base dimension, 12 position spindle lock, weighs 4.1 lbs. Includes: motor, standard base, wrench and instruction manual.Plunge base incorporates fine-tune adjustment rod for precise depth setting. Aluminum motor housing and base construction provides long term durability

AMAZON.COM



Combining power, ease-of-use, ergonomic features and innovations designed for visibility, control and overall performance, the DEWALT DWP611 compact router can handle a variety of applications--from small bevel cuts to large edge profiles and heavy flush trimming. In addition to its beefy 1-1/4 horsepower motor, the DWP611 is equipped with dual LED lights for ample illumination. This package comes with a fixed base, but it's also available as a kit with both fixed and plunge bases.



The DWP611 with fixed base (view larger).



Dual LED's and clear sub-base ensure maximum visibility (view larger).

POWER AND PERFORMANCE
The DWP611 compact router features a 1-1/4 peak HP motor that delivers significantly more power than competitors' models to help you be as productive as possible. The variable speed control helps you to better manage the tool and determine the speed that is best suited for the application at hand. A low, contoured grip that is close to the work surface also contributes to an excellent level of control--providing both precision and productivity on the job site. The soft starting motor features full time electronic feedback that maintains motor speed through the cut. An adjustment ring enables controlled bit depth changes to within 1/64-inch.

COMFORT AND CONVENIENCE
The fixed base's dual LEDs and clear sub-base ensure maximum visibility in operation. The extended 1/4-inch router collet provides greater bit contact with the bit shaft than traditional routers, allowing you a firm grip on the bit and less vibration. The D-shaped sub-base provides stability and flatness when running edge profiles, and the spindle lock has been designed to greatly improve the ease of bit change by incorporating a large button that can be actuated with the same hand that stabilizes the router. 

The router also features two tabs that allow for a quick and simple base release, and a new base/adjustable clamp design so the motor location is maintained through the toughest applications.

WARRANTY
This DEWALT tool is backed by three-year limited warranty covering any defects due to faulty materials or workmanship (from the date of purchase).
